name: Jared Gendron
title: Electrical Engineering Graduate
bio: My name is Jared Gendron and I'm an electrical engineer based in Vancouver, British Columbia. As a recent Electrical Engineering graduate from the University of British Columbia, I aim to leverage my knowledge to contribute highly to your organization. With a profound understanding of electrical systems, I possess strong analytical skills that aid in problem-solving. I seek to join a team of professionals in a dynamic work environment to enhance my skills and make a meaningful contribution to the company's growth.

projects.title: Robotic Arm with 3.5 Degrees of Freedom
projects.subtitle: Controls, Firmware, PCB design
projects.intro: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
projects.description: Took on the control engineering lead in a 3 person team designing a robotic arm with 3.5 degrees of freedom. Designed and fine-tuned a PID controller algorithm using MATLAB & Simulink and ported the algorithm to C for programming a microcontroller to control the robot. Ran thorough control and mechanical simulations of the design using a conjunction of MATLAB/Simulink and SimulationX software simultaneously by sharing feedback variables through computer ports

projects.title: Dynamic Parking Sign
projects.subtitle: Software, Firmware, Hardware
projects.intro: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
projects.description: Collaborated in a 5 person team to design a parking sign with a digital display that can be dynamically changed to display any parking image desired. The parking sign's display is able to be updated through an hourly schedule or by sensor

projects.title: ATM Integrated Chip Design
projects.intro: Designed the finite-state machine for an ATM and designed an integrated chip at the transistor level
projects.description: Demonstrated very large scale integration (VLSI) techniques by designing the finite-state machine of an automated teller machine and designing an integrated chip using software tools such as Cadence Virtuoso

experience.title: Software Developer/Firmware & Hardware Design
experience.intro: Took on management, coordination, and design leads for the Dynamic Parking Signage project
experience.description: Vastly improved the web application to handle future scalability. Improved SQLite database structure to hold more information about devices, schedules, and images. Designed a framework for uploading images to devices and storing them within memory
